title: Efficient and helpful
body: As always, Brooke surgery were efficient and solved my problem straight away. They are always helpful, professional and approachable. I sent a message through AskMyGP today, and it was sorted within the same day. Much appreciated. I would recommend this practise to anyone!

title: Great practice
body: Professional medical practice that I highly recommend. Booked appointment on patches - quick response and then when I saw the doctor my appointment was on time and very thorough. When I had to book bloods afterwards at Reception the receptionist was very polite and booked in bloods for within a couple of days! Highly recommend this practice.

title: Great practice, amazing
body: Manor Park gp surgery is extremely helpful and the receptionists are always willing to help they are very nice and supportive

title: Brilliant experience
body: My boyfriend recently stayed on ward a5 whilst awaiting having brain surgery to have a new shunt fitted. The staff on tbe ward weee so kind and caring . Nothing was too much trouble. He has recently been discharged and said even though he hates hospital it was a pleasant experience . Thank you to all the staff on ward a5

title: Caring and professional
body: I had to call an ambulance as my wife was in severe pain. It arrived inside half an hour and the two chaps were friendly, professional and provided both medical help and sympathetic conversation at a very worrying time. They then transported her to East Surrey hospital where she received emergency surgery and yet more exemplary care. A huge thank you to all involved.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good relaxed community feel
body: The phone system is rubbish, could not get through and line was constantly being cut off, so I went to the surgery, and from there on, the assistance I needed started to be dealt with in an efficient and helpful manor. The appointment was not given by reception but via the duty doctors approval. Once we had the appointment the experience was positive. Our appointment was at Sutton Benger the atmosphere in the surgery was of a community vibe both the receptionist and doctor were efficient and helpful. Hopefully the surgery will be allowed to improve with access to their services via the telephone. Every time I have needed access to the surgery in the last few years it has been fruitless experience holding onto a line that is then dropped before being answered, dropping in has and is on the whole the only way I have found to access the surgery. Just once approximately two years ago my call was answered when I called in the evening to book a flu jab.

title: Very efficient
body: I was given a virtual appointment and was rung at exactly the right time and the doctor I spoke to was professional clear and friendly and accommodating regarding follow up appointment

title: wonderful service
body: I have been highly impressed with the practice. The receptionists are very kind and helpful. The secretaries have always got back to any of my queries super promptly. The doctors we met have been great. Given the amount of pressure there is on the NHS at present I am grateful for all of the help we have had. Thank you

title: Great Doctor Who took Time
body: Asked for a follow up call back and for it on time today. Dr rang and took the time to explain all my results taking each one in turn and giving an explanation of those that were outside normal. One needed follow up and he explained what and when and how. I asked a question and he took good time to answer. He is really excellent and example to some others. Thank you very much

title: Quick Appointments
body:
New process of making appointments is so effective. I was able to get seen within the hour of submitting my request.

The surgery seems to be very well managed.

title: Great practice
body: Was very pleased when I rang at 8 managed to get an appointment for the same day as I'm not often unwell and haven't been to see a doctor for a couple of years but was in a lot of pain

title: Great practice
body: I got an appointment same day I called and the lady doctor was very kind, after asking me about my illness she gave me some helpful suggestions and medicines. I was quiet happy about my visit.

title: Great. Experience
body:
Friendly staff perfect time keeping and good after care 
Put me at ease as soon ai walked through the door 
Very professional

title: Responsive team
body: I had a good experience of care from the surgery.  The asked to be considered to stay at the practice even though I maybe moving out of the area and they responded very promptly with a kind and comprehensive reply, allowing me to stay with them.  I have always found the practice team to be helpful and professional.  I would always recommend this practice.

title: The Best Practice
body:
I had a very supportive Nurse practitioner who was so thoughtful, supportive and sympathetic to my case. I felt I could discuss my needs and history openly and new I would get appropriate advice guidance and direction. 
I cannot thank the Nurse enough as I now feel so much better.

title: Very caring nurses
body: My experience, since joining this surgery last year, has been mainly ok, but the nursing staff are a cut above.  Not only did they make me feel comfortable, they were kind, considerate and very understanding.  Thank you.

title: Very good
body:
Staff are friendly. helpful, courteous. and considerate to all needs. 
Very clean and pleasant building. The mobile unit is a tad small to many people in there waiting at times. Very grateful for a job well done Thank you.

title: kindness and consideration
body: All my experience with this hospital has been good. visited patient this week while doctor strike and computer glitches happening. Yet all staff working hard, time to answer questions and give extra. All staff caring, giving good vibes to patients, working together, run off their feet yet continue smile, cheery and efficient as personel and computer allow. Warm caring people through from reception, nurses, physio, pharmacy, special call out to ambulance staff. Thankyou for your care

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Faultless
body:
I have been to many GP surgeries in my life and this is by far the best.
All the staff are friendly and helpful. Receptionists know how to speak to people and are very kind and patient. The Doctors listen properly and take the trouble to explain things properly. The nurses are lovely and great at what they do. If you want the best care in St Helens,this is the place for you!

title: Good Service
body: Able to park, hospital and dermatology receptions informative and polite.  Punctual appointment with practitione and now await results.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: A good experience
body:
Seen promptly by the doctor and given plenty of time
to explain the symptoms and the reason for attending.
Good parking availability.

title: Friendly and Polite
body: I attended for my annual health check on a Saturday morning. The receptionist was polite and had a friendly manner as was the nurse for the check up.  The appointment was on time and conducted in a friendly calming manner with everything explained clearly . Overall, a stress free visit . Very impressed.

title: Amazing practice
body:
We have just moved to this practice after moving house. From the start we have had exceptional service. Appointments with real live humans, super helpful admin and a pharmacy that really tries to get the medications sorted. 
The thing we like best is that it is all integrated. You can book online, send an email, have appointments with other members of the team and we feel that everyone is so supportive. 

Thank you.

title: Excellent experience
body:
On arrival at the practice The Receptionist was helping a patient so I booked in using the automated system which was faultless and simple to operate. It advised me I had a wait of 4 minutes. Within the 4 minutes a doctor entered the reception area and invited me to join him. 
My overall experience with the doctor was brilliant! Extremely welcoming and reassuring he quickly advised me of the treatment required and way forward. Throughout he kept me informed of what he was doing and why! Furthermore he was able to treat me for a minor condition there and then without referring me to hospital!
A few minutes after leaving I received a text with a link to a summary of my treatment and  future appointments!
Brilliant overall experience.

title: A great experience
body: I try not to contact my GP very often and this time I could only have a phone call. My GP is very kind and considerate. She always remembers my problems  including transport. She quickly assessed my situation and decided to see me very quickly. She will also contact Rheumatology . I have not been to see them since the covid lockdown as she thinks I should be seen.

author: nitrategf44
title: Praise for the staff and management
body:
Recently my wife and I visited from High Wycombe Buckinghamshire. We came to see my wife's cousin who had been seriously ill. We spoke to her and another patient. They were both full of praise for the management and staff and enjoyed the food.  
We know that the NHS in under severe stress so it is a great relief for us to know that your care for patients is so very good. Please pass our thanks and regard to all concerned in Cornwall NHS and in particular to the care home in Tintagel.

title: 1st class service Vine Medical F/end
body:
Contacted by vine medical for my yearly review , Went in on time , young nurse met me and took me to her room , treated and explained everything very well , kept me calm throughout my visit  
A credit to vine medical Forest End. 
All like Clockwork well done all

title: Great practice
body: Fantastic service by all staff. Everyone was so professional. I could hear the nurses having a little laugh and giggle before i entered for my op. This made me feel they are a happy group. This made me feel at ease to see people like these Thank you all. Keep up the great wotk.

title: Great care
body: Writing on behalf of my grandparents, had excellent care and follow-up. Treated with respect, not rushed and felt heard/listened to. Thank you for all your hard work, and the receptionists and nurses, along with the doctors, have been very courteous and caring.

title: Great practice
body: From start to finish, everyone is so kind, informative and caring. This is a wonderful service offered through our national health service.

title: Excellent  practice
body: I am diabetic and this practice  has done more for me in the short time  I have been with you. than my last doctors of 15  plus years ever did for me keep up the excellent service be rest assured  that all my family and friends know about  the excellent  service you provide  thank you.

title: Exemplary service
body: I was a patient having a knee arthroscopy yesterday through surgical day stay unit. Starting from the reception, each and every staff member were polite, very helpful and professional in their interactions. I was extremely impressed with the care and attention that I received yesterday. I would like to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for your kindness.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Knowledgeable  staff
body: My physiotherapy  appointment was very good .I was given time to understand my injury and ways to manage it with a range of exercises   to follow .Very professional  staff and an on time appointment.

title: Great practice
body: Very friendly and informative physiotherapist. Helped me feel at ease. Explained my condition and told me what was going to happen next

title: Dissatisfied with service
body:
No way to book an app on the phone. Only econsultations, to which they reply telling you you will be contacted many days later, they don't give you a time of the day when Dr will call you. They only call you once and don't try again.  Since covid the service in this surgery has gone down hill. I was very ill recently had to put about 3 econsultations did not get a call only a cough syrup and nasal spray sent to the chemist over 3 weeks after the problem started. I had to put another e consultation like begging for Dr to call me.  Today the Dr called to discuss blood tests and unfortunately I press the wrong key and cut him off, I called the receptionist and explained, she said she will put a note for the Dr to call again. Nobody call.
My son had an accident and asked for x-ray form to check if rib broken, was given a f2f app for next week 3 weeks after the initial incident. The advice was if he could not wait go to a and E. If u have a suspected urine infection u still have to do an econsultation and wait for them to contact you to tell u to bring a sample.
I work in a surgery and there patients can make on the day apps for emergencies, or prebookable for the week or 2 ahead. In case of uti patients dropped urine and is dipped by the nurse. We don't get inundated with urine samples, as the receptionist at bellgrove surgery claimed is the case. On a bad day max 5 urine samples.
I have been with this surgery for 25 years, but lately the service is pitiful you are made to feel as if Drs are doing you a favour. 
The system should be improved to give pts options of booking apps on the phone and to consider that pts work and can't take a call any time and to call the pt twice if pt did not answer. It is the case in other surgeries not only where I work.
I know you probably think that if I am not happy I should find another surgery, that's not the solution.
I am extremely dissatisfied at the inflexible changes the surgery have made.

title: Appointment
body: Terrible medical centre. In reception workers saying on the phone that they will call back later to see doctor for my 11months old son. They never called back.

title: Receptionists need basic training
body:
No option to give a rating of 0. The receptionists are patronising, rude and try to provoke arguments - when they dont get an aggressive response they react as if they have for the benefit of their colleagues sat in the same room as them. One in particular has a habit of calling people love and thinks its appropriate to burst into tears for no reason and then proceed to say she is unwell. If she is unwell, she should not be dealing with patients. Given all the posters saying they expect respect and will not tolerate rude or aggressive behaviour youd think theyd learn to treat patients with the same courtesy. 

Only call this practice if you want to make yourself feel even worse. 

Until they start recording calls I fear this level of service will remain the same.

title: Doctors don't care
body: Patient ignored , appointment not entered on the system for life saving cancer treatment, a couldn't care less attitude from doctors, as my husband's registered carer this is the treatment I witness my husband receiving at the Haxby group. Took my husband to the surgery after painful lesions developed on his head and we were told to send in photo.Recieved a message back to say doctor wanted to see him but had to wait four weeks for appointment!!!! On palliative care yet can't get an appointment and no appointment came !!!! I took him back to the surgery and was told doctor would send for him later that day but no!!! a phone call later but no face to face appointment so no actual examination and told he would send a prescription for cream. I told the doctor he was on palliative care and the response was " So what do you want from us " As he wasn't physically examined the doctor couldn't tell from a photo that the lesions were infected and required an antibiotic cream. The doctor also told us that he would place my husband on a Three month waiting list for an appointment. This is Disgraceful treatment !!!!!

title: Great Practice
body: I must say, out of every experience I have had with GPs, hospitals and clinics I have never been treated with so much care. Firstly my mental health was a shambles, which I think was quiet visible. This was their first priority! Secondly every single member of the team were compassionate. I have never experienced this in one place before. Thirdly, during my procedure you could see I was very anxious before the general anaesthesia, the Surgeon and the Anaesthetists wasted no time, introduced themselves to me while getting me prepared. They kept me in conversation, reassured me and the Anaesthetists should be a stand up comedian, he was fantastic. Lastly once taken into the official room I was lying down with people around me feeling so scared and out of nowhere another midwife comes to hold my hand and then I was out like a light with the anaesthetic. Once I was awake I was taken complete care of. This was one of the hardest decisions I have ever had to make but the staff made it so much easier for me. I am extremely grateful.

title: Very poor pain management at Telford hospital
body: My GP and also the local basic pain management team director sent me here to one of your pain management anaesthetist consultants to get my pain addressed as it is too complex for basic local pain management in community to deal with and needs injections and other more direct interventional treatment rather than diet, exercise, mindfulness, etc all of which have been unsuccessful,. Problem is is that your consultant has denied me service and will not see me and has been rude by not even talking to me about my options or at all as I only found out by going to my GP and the referral assessment team who informed me of this. Disgusting behaviour from a team that should be working to treat pain rather than denying us our services we pay for as tax payers. How many other people have been denied the services like me? This needs auditing independently. Am still in severe pain with no help from anyone. Thanks for helping me, not! Shut this service down as it is not seeing or treating patients anyway so it is a complete waste of mine and other tax payers' money.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Difficult times
body: I would just like to thank all the doctors and nurses in the urology department and the prostrate biopsy department for the excellent service that I received in these difficult times. Having been given full details by friendly doctors and nurses also taking the time to ask and answer any questions I might have asked

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Practice
body: Although it has taken about a month to actually sort my husbands latest problem ,re medication etc.. The initial consultation with the GP was efficient and effective.The receptionist and ANPs and practice nurses have been excellent. Just frustrating at times.

title: Good practices
body: Nurse very nice pleasant and knowledgeable answered all my queries and gave very good advice carried out test and made me feel relaxed took time to assure me over negative points I had

title: Disappointed is a very mild word to describe this
body:
I have been with this practice for 65 years and what a change there has been !!
You can never see your nominated doctor as he only works 2 days a week. Then you are told he is working and on his list to phone you, after filling in an e consult form on website. You wait for a phone call all day ..... nothing. Phoned  surgery the next day, to be informed he was never working on that day !!! I rarely go to the doctor,Im not a frequent flyer,  but when I do I would like to see a 
specific doctor who will know my history . Why is this so difficult ?

I am thinking very seriously about moving practices where they have more doctors available . 
This practice probably has no more patients now than it used to, 60 years ago The only thing is that we live longer !! So please help us !!

title: Poor appointment system
body: Had a Saturday appt at Beckenham Beacon Cator Centre but needed to cancel on the day. There was no way of cancelling or speaking to an operator on a Saturday, couldnt reschedule. Was trying to do the right thing but with no staff available on a Saturday it was impossible. Why offer Sat appts if you dont have staff at the Cator Centre to man the calls??? Time wasting for doctors if they cant be informed of cancellations!!!

title: Amazing Paramedics! Thank you!
body: Thank you to the two East Mids Ambulance Paramedics who attended an incident with my father on the evening of March 26th, 2023 and took him to Lincoln County Hospital. They were two incredible women who made what was a scary and upsetting situation so much easier to handle. They were calm, practical and easy to chat to. It means the world that they were with me and me mum, that night. Thank you!

title: disappointing practice
body: email for e-consultant  link as had blood in urine and ask for advice or regarding seeing doctor or nurse, email me back and stated they removed it for the best interest of safety and patient??? only used for sick notes e.c.t.... and told just to keep ringing up from 8am to try get appointment. spoke to practice manager again no advice given regarding blood or hub number or what to do, as well as dealing with a complaint  i had about a gp?? manager never listened sadly, not given patients  the choice if they found better making appointments on?? it was change a week ago..... so now i been ringing and 39 in que? so taking away on line appointments has hindered the patients more so the variable, elderly, disability, well being, for these who can not Offord to keep on phone, manager mention someone who deals with my c.o.p.d, medication will contact me?? this not relevant  to the blood in my urine , i did mention i not uncomfortable, but feel mu urine needed to be checked, again not one bit of advice in the email  or over the phone.... Now i ask myself removing the on line appointment, or e-consultation  was it for the interest of the GP surgery it self has patient never had a choice , so now are suffering.... you can not email practice manager has all receptionist reads and sees?? so not confidential... i understand covid played  a big role, but we are back to normal and i feel it is used now as an excuse to most medical practices ... But for this GP practice to remove on line and e-consultation  not informing patients by text or letter is terrible, now we suffer... the point of this at least GPs can read see images to decide weather appointment is needed or direct patient or advice patient what  best to do?? i got copies of the email not been given advice and a witness regarding phone call no advice given not even by practice manager

title: 3 visits and still not right
body: 3 visits to A&E after infection after private surgery. Kept being told to take pain relief even though UTI showed an infection, have then been sent away with a catheter to be told there's a 4 week waiting list for removal and no doctors/chemist will help me do a 7 day change which I wasn't even told about. I wasn't given night bags or any advice. I can't fault the nurses but three visits and I'm now stuck with this that is probably going to cause more infection.

title: First class practice
body: Cant thank the staff in A&E enough for their dedication and care when my husband, who has dementia was taken Ill.  Their kindness, humour, and especially patience made the visit less stressful for me.

title: Excellent
body: Excellent care from Ward 50. All the staff are very professional and attentive at all times. Nothing is too much trouble. The ward is immaculately clean,the food is good - the staff ensure that you have what you want to eat and drink. Nursing staff are the tops

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Unhelpful reception and rude
body:
Ive just tried to book a face to face review for my wife and myself, we dont like the telephone ones as the last one was a complete waste of time. The receptionist would only offer a telephone one which when we declined because were not available and want a face to face became very aggressive and put the phone down on me. I believe as a patient I have a right to a face to face appointment?
Such a shame as this used to be an excellent practice.

title: Going downhill
body: I ordered my medication on line as recommended by the practice. When collecting I found out that I was short by 2 medications. Called the practice and with option 5 I was put on hold and I was number 2 in queue and probably after 25 minutes I was number 1. I kept on hold for another 10 minutes when I realised that it is better I walk down to the clinic instead. After almost 40 minutes of holding on line I was disconnected. I went to the reception and enquired about my missing prescription which after some time was told by another young girl at the back office that they had missed them as it was done by some trainee. A very lame excuse from a professional who is in charge of medications for the patients. If a trainee is handling the prescriptions than is not she/he supervised? Anyway then I was told that a new prescription will be forwarded in the evening and I will get my missing medication on the following day which is a Saturday. But as a rule the prescriptions take at least 48 hours at the pharmacy to process so that makes it to following week before I get my medications. I was given an apology which I have to be satisfied with but how can I accept that when this was not the first time it has happened at this surgery. Moreover about my phone call I was told that phones are not manned during afternoon time so your staff think that we as patients are stupid who call on an open line and wait for 45 minutes without being attended to because the phone line is not manned. What is wrong with you people who act as the most unprofessional manner in the most responsible place??? I would definitely love you guys get treated in the same way as us. We are warned by your office that you will not tolerate abusive behaviour but if your staff come up aggressive behaviour and is right on your face than that is acceptable by you. I have been with this surgery for the last 23 years (Carlisle House before) but the standards are just going down and am very disappointed at this latter stage of my life when I am more dependent on the Surgery. Need to do some improvement at the office area now as I am not the only one who is complaining about the services given by you front desk staff.

title: Awful
body: Waited four weeks for a telephone appt where it was clearly obvious a face to face was required, as expected then had to go in, no idea why they cant use some common sense around deciding whether an appt should be in person or not - very inefficient and takes no account of the impacts to the  patient. Finally got to see a doctor - and I am quite accepting that it took 4 weeks, I can appreciate the current situation. Was told I needed to be referred, on week 5 on not receiving the referral !!! Ring up reception they say yes it on the system just has been completed to send out - cant say when it will be!! I wouldnt mind it taking a while if they could even give an indication of when it will be done. Just unacceptable.

title: Unconcerned
body: I am a cancer patient and duly booked my required blood test through the complex care team for the day before my chemotherapy only to have my appointment cancelled by text just before the Practice finished for the Easter bank holiday as the nurse would be ill on the following Tuesday!The clerical staff were sorry for the inconvenience!This action caused severe mental distress over the bank holiday period as I was concerned as to whether my chemotherapy would be cancelled due to the necessary blood test being unavailable.Contacting the Practice on the Tuesday and explaining that the blood test was necessary I was yet again informed they were sorry for the inconvenience and offered a test on the day of the chemotherapy appointment, obviously no one had bothered to read my medical notes.I find this uncaring, unconcerned attitude utterly unacceptable.

title: Takes forever to get anything done.
body: Ive run out of my daily medication now but I put in a prescription request in using the app on the 8th and Ive still heard nothing yet. I guess I will have to go to 111 to order an emergency supply due to the failings of this practice. I will be leaving next month.

title: Disgraceful
body: Had an appointment for a scan. Sat patiently in the waiting room for an hour. When I asked, I was told that my appointment had been cancelled by "Patient request", and refused to see me. Absolutely appalling.

title: Great service during the junior doctors' strike
body:
Late evening around 9pm I had to attend A&E, fully aware this was during the junior doctors' strike.  Despite the strain this must have placed on the department I have nothing but praise for the people I met and the treatment I received. The lady on the A&E check-in desk, the triage nurse and the doctor were all most helpful, friendly and professional. I also did not experience any long periods waiting to be seen. I was sent home after tests were carried out and receiving painkillers, knowing that I would come back the following day for a scan. The efficiency continued - I had a call early the following morning at 9 am asking me to have a scan.
A huge thank you!!!

title: Not suitable for kids/babies
body: I took my toddler to a doctor here three times. And this thing happened the twice. My son starts crying with fear and reason is.. the doctor didnt great him, didnt say hello, didnt say what he was going to do. Think if this happens to you, some one comes and touches you and you dont know whats happening and what will his next step be. Please take the time to consider kids as person too. Take the time to say hello, how are you today? Look him in the face and say Im going to take you temperature now from your ear itll only take a second. If you are not doing that, at least give me a second to tell my kid myself that what is this doctor going to do next.

title: Good doctors practice
body: Just wish wasnt so difficult to get face to face appointments. Very pleased with service we receive from doctors

title: Quick availability long wait
body: I was able to get an appointment using the patches app, however my appointment was at 11.30am and i wasnt seen until 11.55am which delayed my day

title: Greatly exceeded expectations
body:
My husband received a telephone appointment about which we were quite anxious. In a very short time the doctor conveyed 100% commitment to achieving the most helpful and acceptable way forward. He also had an extremely kind and reassuring approach - difficult to achieve over the phone.
We are very grateful. Thank you.

title: will not rectify there mistakes
body: after waiting three weeks for a face to face appointment l went to the surgery for ten past eight which was my appointment time and checked in on the computer.after waiting twenty minutes the receptionist came over and said there had been a mistake and the doctor was working from home and that the next available appointment was in eleven days time and l said l was not happy waiting so long due to no fault of my own and asked for her to get the practice manager to cal me.that afternoon i got a call from the receptionist saying the practice manager was not in that day and that she could not offer another earlier appointment than the one she gave me l said  l was not happy with this and asked if she could get the practice manager to call me the following day which she agreed.the following day l had not received a call by one thirty so l called again saying l was waiting for a call from the practice manager she said the manager was not at there desk so would send a message so l asked what time was the manager there till and told me six o clock.l waited till five forty and still had no phone call and receptionist said she had gone home but could see that a massage had been sent to the manager by the previous receptionist and said she was sorry but could not help me any more.the practice manager is to sort out these problem and come to a amicable decision but how can this happen when patients can not get in contact with the manager and the managers colleagues get hold of the manager.awaiting a reply but who knows when

title: Long Wait
body: I attended promptly for my appointment and it appeared that several people had been given the same time. I was there for two and a half hours, mainly sitting in a corridor. The optometrist was clearly harassed and made no attempt to hide it. In the end I was referred back to my GP.

title: No baby facilities
body: Recently visited with my baby. Absolutely no baby changing facilities. Ended up having to change my son on the floor of the disabled toilets. Simply not good enough.

title: 2 week referral time - 5 weeks!
body: The two week referral for a breast lump could not be met by the hospital. Instead, the appointment was nearer to 5 weeks. The NHS states that there is a legal right to be seen within this time but there seems to be no alternative but to wait. Meanwhile, the lump is growing and Im stressed and not sleeping.

title: practice
body:
I was asked to see a doctor and then he asked what he could do for me.  I was referred by another doctor in the practice.
But he was friendly and went through a few things, but did not check my rash or  blood pressure

title: Great practice
body: All Staff and doctors are helpful and professional. Reception staff do a great job even though they have to put up with abuse from some patients.

title: Still waiting for assistance 25 days later!
body:
Day 25, still nothing from BPAS! 
I went else where in this time and just made the deadline for 10 weeks to have an at home tablet abortion. BPAS hasn't even started the process as of yet. Disgraceful.

title: What a difference
body: Usually when I am ringing to get a follow up eye appointment which is usually overdue I get told I am on a waiting list and cannot be given a date - so frustrating!. However this time I actually got an appointment at what I believe is referred to as the Glaucoma maintenance clinic. It was very well organised as you went through each diagnostic test.  The staff were extremely helpful (which I have to say they usually are).  There were no long waiting times between the different tests - which included eye pressure, fields test and a scan.  I was able to get some questions I had from my last appointment explained.  Altogether a better way.

title: Urology
body: Recently I had surgery for a stricture in my urethra etc under general ansphetic , I woke up with a bag fitted , but changed to flip flow . After almost one week with the catheter, it was removed & wow !! Superb urine flow , almost like a jet wash each time I use the loo . I was on ward 20 BRI .. id like to thank the surgeon & staff for an excellent job .. very very impressed  the NHS Deserves massive pay increases without any doubt .. its changed my life .. thank you

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Nurses really dismissive
body: We come in for the 8th time in 9 months with an ovarian cyst which the operation keeps getting move. Head surgeon said this needs operating on soon! We have come back in with vomiting and sicknesss and upon trying to explain what is happening we were asked stupid questions such as, have you eaten something dodgy. I think tried to explain my partner needed to go onto fluids and antisickness as quick as possible, as we have had this 8 times before. This was ignored and we were made to sit and wait for 5 hours, which saw my partner get more lethargic and almost too weak to speak. This hospital is going down and down

title: my appointment at breast clinic and breast scan
body: I attended my appointment 15th april 10 45   was greeted by a lovely young receptionist followed by a very nice consultant who made me feel at ease   in fact I am writing this because everyone in each department  could'nt have been more friendly or reassuring  Thank you to you all.

title: Excellent Care
body: on behalf of the kelly family, we would like to say a very big thank you for the excellent nursing care provided by all staff in ward 28a. staff treated our mum with kindness and respect throughout her care, to sadly her passing away

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent experience
body: Excellent service, professional and polite staff. I had an excellent level of care from the team at Medefer.

title: Cardiology
body: We are so fortunate to have such a caring QE cardiology "team" at this hospital.  Having been in-patient (CCU 2022) & a regular over the last 8 years at outpatients, I would say to anyone facing surgery/treatment or a consultation here I am sure that like me you will be amazed at the standard of care whether from  the secretarial/reception staff/clinicians carrying out tests and to everyone of the nurses & cardiologists. Even the communication & follow-up letters/appointments are received within days.  I had a 17hour wait last summer in A&E and ok it wasn't easy but,I would rather be there than suffering at home & not knowing what was wrong. The care on CCU was unbelievable.  Despite being super busy they always have time & patience to explain procedures. Words cannot begin describe this particular hospital department.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great staff
body: I was in the London Irish ward for 11 days.the staff were brilliant from the cleaners to the surgeon. The nurses helped me so much.i really can not thank you all enough.

title: Safe place
body: When having to make hard decision on a family member , Byker lodge is the place , friendly staff ,safe environment, Guest have there own room ,Fresh food is made on site ,and there a dinning room we're it's served, lovely conservatory to sit in,well staffed .Think that covers everything .

title: Lovely, attentive staff
body:
I have just returned home from a 3 night stay in Woodcock ward with my 5 month old son. He was admitted with breathing difficulties so it was a very worrying situation.
I cannot praise the staff enough from the Childrens assessment unit to the staff on the ward. Nothing was too much trouble and they were constantly asking and checking if we needed anything.
My daughter who is 3 came to visit and the play specialist made her feel so welcome in the activity room and kept her smiling with various activities. She had really missed her brother but this made a potentially scary experience really relaxed and not frightening for her. 
Having a poorly child is the worse experience but Woodcock ward have turned a horrible few days much more manageable.
Thank you all, each and everyone of you!

title: Great oractice
body: Although we had to wait nearly three hours the staff were extremely helpful and it put our minds at rest. Couldnt have wished for a better team thank you.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Faultless quick treatment and care.
body: Arrived by ambulance with my elderly mum who had collapsed .Wonderful staff who calmly did blood tests ,blood pressure ,ct head scan and put her on a drip .Own big cubicle which was spotlessly clean .She was give sandwiches and tea .Very thorough checks .Such a positive experience .Also the 2 lovely paramedics who were so patient and caring . Just cant thank you all enough .

title: Awful
body: Already explained how bad they are but have not seen my review displayed, never been registered with such a bad GP surgery, don't know how they are taking new [patients they cant provide a service to the patients they have,  The staff are appalling not helpful at all, only send messages to say don't contact them.  Have to use walk in service they should be closed down

title: Disgusting service
body: 6 weeks ago I went to Accrington Victoria to have my bloods done it was a Sunday and a really nice nurse took them, I have been today and I was called a liar and was refused my bloods to be taken from a sister as she said that they never take bloods, what kind of treatment is that? I am absolutely disgusted yes it was a Saturday but isnt the NHS not 24 hour service? Nobody was in the waiting room or in A&E as I was there as soon as it opened, these bloods are to keep a check on my kidney transplant, the NHS is supposed to be a caring profession, someone needs to tell the sister!

title: Excellent Care
body:
Our 95year old uncle was admitted to Resus on the 19/3/2023 from the moment he was put to bed the care from doctors& nurseswas impeccable as an ex nurse who had heard some unwanted criticism about Royal Blackburn I was proud to say I was  once part of this profession. 
Unfortunately the outcome was very sad but as I stated the whole staff gave their all no corners were cut they worked their heart out to maintain his dignity ect.the staffs attention was not only for the patient but to the relatives the respect and cordiality that was given was exceptional we cant praise them enough, 
a thankyou doesnt seem enough to all concerned but 
thankyou to all that was on duty that day

title: Above and Beyond
body:
I have
nothing but praise for all the staff at this practice. The
receptionists, who must be under huge pressure at the momemt, are
always pleasant, patient and kind. If I have a particular problem,
they will always do their best to sort it. I always feel that I
really matter - and that they really care.

The nurses are very pleasant, kind and efficient.

My own gp is kind, caring and knowledgeable, as is my experience of some of the other gps.

If I need to speak to a dr urgently by phone, this is always
expedited quickly and efficiently.

East Quay and its staff offer a truely exceptional service.

Thank you

title: Fantastic care from A&E Minor Injuries and
body: Really impressed with the service at a&e. I was seen quickly by a nurse and sent for X-rays. The X-ray team were fantastic and quickly referred me to an orthopaedic surgeon. The doctor and nurse had a lovely manner and couldnt have been more helpful and supportive. Honestly couldnt have asked for a better a&e experience or kinder doctors and nurses.

title: Brilliant experience
body: I popped to the Hollies with our younger son for his asthma review. We saw one of the nurse practitioners who was so lovely. She explained about asthma very clearly to my 11 year old son, using simple age appropriate descriptions on how asthma affects the lungs, and how the different inhalers work to relieve or prevent symptoms. She assessed his lungs with a peak flow and asked relevant questions about his asthma symptoms direct to my son, whilst referring back to me when necessary. My sons prescription was altered plus a more compact spacer was prescribed, making it easier for him to transport to school if necessary. The nurse was very professional, friendly and approachable and as we left the surgery, my son commented on how nice and kind she was. All the staff at The Hollies Medical Centre are amazing and work incredibly hard. Thank you all so much for everything that you do for us all.

title: Not good communication
body: I had a cholesterol test. The board said Mrs for the doctor but it turned out to be a man who said the boards are always wrong. He was not very communicative and left a large bruise where he took the blood. Actually he might have been a nurse not really sure

title: Great practice
body:
We couldn't be happier with this practice and its doctor and staff. 
They are kind and efficient. 
I would highly recommend this place to my friends

title: Great practice
body:
We couldn't be happier with this practice and its doctor and staff. 
They are kind and efficient. 
I would highly recommend this place to my friends

title: Great practice
body:
We couldn't be happier with this practice and its doctor and staff. 
They are kind and efficient. 
I would highly recommend this place to my friends

title: Great practice
body:
We couldn't be happier with this practice and its doctor and staff. 
They are kind and efficient. 
I would highly recommend this place to my friends

title: Great service.
body: Peverell park surgery is a friendly and professional led service.  All of our experiences with the practice have been very good and we are so lucky to have such a good GP surgery. Thank you.

title: It a good practice
body: The nurse who i saw was very polite and took her time to talk to me cause I have got learning disabilities and mental health problems

title: Good practice
body: Surgery was running late (junior doctors strike making it very busy) but when it was my turn I was not made to feel I had to rush - the doctor gave me time to explain why I needed the appointment. The pharmacy dealt with my prescription promptly. Waiting room and reception were clean and tidy.

title: Good practice
body: Recently I have been impressed by the improvements made at Whitehall Medical Practice. I am particularly happy about the reception staff on the front desk (in particular Marisol). On the occasions I have been to the surgery always greeted in a friendly and pleasant manner and not made to feel like the receptionist is doing me favour. I have also used the e-consult service many times which has saved me from trips to the surgery for things that a simple over the phone or video diagnosis would deal with.

title: Professional and excellent service
body: I contacted the practice for an appointment not knowing if it would be a callback in the first instance but after describing my symptoms I was given a face to face appointment by the very helpful receptionist within 2 hours of my call.  The GP listened and guided by my symptoms decided to do blood tests etc immediately rather than waiting for a nurse appointment so that the results will be back within a few days.  I cannot fault the service I have been given so far and feel confident that if I require any ongoing treatment that this will be dealt with swiftly too.

title: Minor Surgery
body: The op was carried out quickly and efficiently with little pain, the doctor and nurse put me at ease and explained the procedure, which went well. I would definitely recommend minor surgery at Burscough Family Practice

title: A Pleasure
body: Had my appointment today (Sunday) and the nurse/doctor was brilliant I'm sorry I can't remember her name. She was very professional and knowledgeable and I left feeling very upbeat about my diagnosis

title: Wonderful service
body: Sent to out of ours Fiennes Centre with my 1 year old after calling 111. The staff were wonderful. From the lady who checked us in the the doctor who checked him over. I couldnt fault them. I waited all of about 5 mins to be seen. It was last thing on a Saturday, early evening & everyone was happy friendly & professional. They even gifted my son a teddy when he was upset after being examined. 5/5 a++. Thank you to them all!!

title: Excellent service
body: I attended A and E on a Sunday morning and received excellent service from a professional and caring practitioner- I couldnt have had better treatment
